bio: Joseph Naylor is a member of the Wilmington office, focusing his practice on advising and representing clients in corporate and complex commercial litigation, products liability litigation, bankruptcy, appellate, and insurance-defense matters. For over 25 years, Mr. Naylor has litigated cases before all of Delaware’s state and federal courts, achieving positive resolutions in a vast array of disputes.

Swartz Campbell’s Wilmington office presently represents over 100 clients in asbestos-related lawsuits—more than any other Delaware firm—and has been trial counsel in most asbestos cases that have gone to trial since the mid-2000s. Mr. Naylor serves as lead Delaware counsel for more than a dozen asbestos clients, including several publicly traded, self-insured Fortune 500 companies who are often the primary targets of these lawsuits. He has argued and won dozens of motions for summary judgment, including several seminal rulings that are regularly cited by the Court and practitioners. He also obtained dismissal for a non-Delaware corporation based on lack of personal jurisdiction, in what has become the seminal post-Daimler opinion in Delaware discussing general-jurisdiction principles in an asbestos case.

Beyond asbestos, Mr. Naylor has extensive experience defending high-stakes, high-profile product liability and pharmaceutical litigation. He frequently represents Fortune 500 companies, including an international pharmaceutical company named in more than 85,000 cases alleging that Zantac/Ranitidine caused cancer. He also recently worked as part of a multi-state team defending a major chemical company against claims of cancer caused by polyfluoroalkyl substances—often referred to as “forever chemicals.”

Mr. Naylor has handled a variety of matters for insured parties in cases involving serious personal injuries, property damage, construction defects, and corporate/securities litigation. He has successfully defended property owners in premises-liability cases, contractors and vendors in fire/casualty litigation, private and municipal employers in employment litigation, and insurance carriers in coverage disputes with their insureds and other carriers.

Mr. Naylor is a former clerk to the Honorable Joseph T. Walsh of the Supreme Court of Delaware and has an active appellate practice. He has successfully argued multiple asbestos-related appeals to the Supreme Court of Delaware. He was lead Delaware counsel as part of a multi-firm appellate defense team that obtained the reversal of a $2.8 million asbestos verdict, and is also one of only a few attorneys in Delaware history to have argued an asbestos-related appeal to a full en banc panel of the Supreme Court of Delaware. Videos of Mr. Naylor’s arguments in these cases can be found at: https://courts.delaware.gov/supreme/oralarguments.
In addition to asbestos matters, he has defended a wide variety of clients in appellate proceedings, including:

• An insurance carrier in a coverage dispute with an insured racetrack after a horseracing injury
  • The developer of a hotel in a zoning dispute with New Castle County
  • A furniture-and-design company in a commercial lease dispute
  • A condominium association council in a contract / fiduciary duty dispute

Prior to joining Swartz Campbell, Mr. Naylor worked for an Am Law 200 firm specializing in corporate and commercial litigation. He acted as lead counsel in numerous cases involving fights for corporate control, contract disputes, and expedited requests for injunctive relief, particularly in business cases of national and international import. National publications such as the New York Times and the Wall Street Journal have mentioned him by name and cited his cases. He has also represented creditors in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court for the District of Delaware and has handled numerous adversary matters over his career.
